snippet: A hallmark of Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s leadership has been a crackdown on freedom of expression, but critics say censorship reflects the government’s Islamist values.
abstract: Turkey's censorship policy, which blocks access to websites government finds objectionable, does not extend to sites that advocate Islamic extremism or even some that recruit Turks to join Islamic State; some critics say Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan's selective crackdown on freedom of speech reflect's government's Islamic values.
lead_paragraph: A hallmark of Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s leadership has been a crackdown on freedom of expression, but critics say censorship reflects the government’s Islamist values.

headline.main: Islamist Websites in Turkey Manage to Evade Strict Internet Censorship
headline.print_headline: Extremist Websites Manage to Evade Strict Censorship in Turkey

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
